Memory services
[Platform abstraction]

Detailed Description

The memory service functions are used by the transmitter (client) to allocate and de-allocate memory during runtime. Some of the set-up parameters (such as configuration.queueMaxMemory) can be used to impose limits on parts of the IPDR memory allocation; you may wish to impose additional limits on the amount of memory that the IPDR transmitter (client) can allocate.

The memory used by IPDR transmitter (client) is allocated and de-allocated by functions supplied by the host application during initialization. To improve performance, the transmitter (client) uses internal memory pools that reduce the number of memory allocation/de-allocation requests. The IPDR transmitter (client) memory pools are based on pre-allocated, relatively large, memory chunks (more chunks can be allocated at runtime on a per need basis) out of which smaller buffers are efficiently allocated.

The following memory pools are used by the transmitter (client):

queue
a per session memory pool used for storing records.
data_rcv
a pool used for storing received messages (per collector (server) connection)
data_snd
a pool used for storing sent control messages (per collector (server) connection)
send_buffer
a small (< 100 bytes in most cases) memory region used for storing references to memory regions which are going to be sent over the transport layer (per collector (server) connection)
Memory pools are allocated with an initial chunk size, pre-allocated number of chunks and have an optional size limit. Each has its own configuration parameter (see the various xxxMaxMem parameters described with IPDR_ParametersHandlerFunc).

Typedef Documentation

typedef IPDR_Status(* IPDR_MemoryAllocate_t)(IPDR_PlatformArg P, size_t Size, void **Buf)
 

Function called by the transmitter (client) in order to allocate a block of memory. The function must allocate at least the amount of memory requested by the function. The memory must be aligned on the most restrictive boundary (as for C's malloc()).

Parameters:
P The context argument when calling platform function, as passed to IPDR_InitExporter().
Size The number of bytes to allocate.
Buf (output) Pointer to the allocated memory; 0 (NULL) if failure (IPDR_ERR_ALLOCATION_FAILED).
Returns:
IPDR_OK on success; IPDR_ERR_ALLOCATION_FAILED or IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE otherwise.

typedef IPDR_Status(* IPDR_MemoryAllocateWithHdr_t)(IPDR_PlatformArg P, size_t HdrSize, size_t Size, void **Buf)
 

Allocate memory, given a chunk size and a header size. This is used to allocate "objects" in a safe way. Same as IPDR_MemoryAllocate_t(P, HdrSize+Size, Buf).

Parameters:
P The context argument when calling platform function, as passed to IPDR_InitExporter().
HdrSize Size of a header that goes in front of the data; must be sizeof ObjectHeader in MemoryManagement.h
Size The number of bytes to allocate.
Buf (output) Pointer to the allocated memory; 0 (NULL) if failure (IPDR_ERR_ALLOCATION_FAILED).
Returns:
IPDR_OK on success; IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE otherwise.
See also:
IPDR_MemoryAllocate_t

typedef IPDR_Status(* IPDR_MemoryFree_t)(IPDR_PlatformArg P, void *Buf)
 

Free memory allocated by IPDR_MemoryAllocate.

Parameters:
P The context argument when calling platform function, as passed to IPDR_InitExporter().
Buf The pointer to the memory allocated by IPDR_MemoryAllocate.
Returns:
IPDR_OK on success; IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE otherwise.

typedef IPDR_Status(* IPDR_MemoryFreeWithHdr_t)(IPDR_PlatformArg P, size_t HdrSize, void *Buf)
 

Free memory allocated by ::IPDR_MemoryAllocateWithHdr.

Parameters:
P The context argument when calling platform function, as passed to IPDR_InitExporter().
Returns:
IPDR_OK on success; IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE otherwise.
See also:
IPDR_MemoryFree_t

typedef IPDR_Status(* IPDR_MemoryStatistics_t)(IPDR_PlatformArg P, unsigned int *numAllocs, unsigned int *numFrees, size_t *bytesAllocated)
 

Get statistics on memory allocation.

Parameters:
P The context argument when calling platform function, as passed to IPDR_InitExporter().
numAllocs The number of calls to the IPDR_MemoryAllocate_t or IPDR_MemoryAllocateWithHdr_t services.
numFrees The number of calls to the IPDR_MemoryFree_t or IPDR_MemoryFreeWithHdr_t services.
bytesAllocated (output) The total number of bytes currently allocated.
Returns:
IPDR_OK on success; IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE otherwise.
